entry.title: Leaders in Australian Computing Research Begin Battle with COVID-19

link.title: Leaders in Australian Computing Research Begin Battle with COVID-19

entry.content: NCI Australia and the Pawsey Supercomputing Centre are supporting the Australian and international research community undertaking COVID-19 research through provision of streamlined, prioritised and expedited access to computation and data resources.
entry.summary: NCI Australia and the Pawsey Supercomputing Centre are supporting the Australian and international research community undertaking COVID-19 research through provision of streamlined, prioritised and expedited access to computation and data resources.

entry.title: Galaxy Australia COVID-19 dedicated Pulsar
entry.content:
Galaxy Australia relies on remote (to head node) deployments called Pulsar to increase the range and number of jobs that can be run on the service. The team has been allocated resources on the Nimbus cloud to deploy a dedicated COVID-19 Pulsar as part of Galaxy Australia at the Pawsey Centre that allows Galaxy users to rapidly analyse their data on published tools/workflows to further research into SARS-CoV-2.

  • Dr. Gareth Price
entry.summary: Galaxy Australia relies on remote (to head node) deployments called Pulsar to increase the range and number of jobs that can be run on the service. The team has been allocated resources on the Nimbus cloud to deploy a dedicated COVID-19 Pulsar as part of Galaxy Australia at the Pawsey Centre that allows Galaxy users to rapidly analyse their data on published tools/workflows to further research into SARS-CoV-2.

entry.title: We just lost James Taylor (1979-2020)
entry.content: We just lost James Taylor (1979-2020). His legacy — open, reproducible science — will continue.
entry.summary: We just lost James Taylor (1979-2020). His legacy — open, reproducible science — will continue.

entry.title: Galaxy Australia upgraded to Galaxy version 20.01

link.title: Galaxy Australia upgraded to Galaxy version 20.01

entry.content:
Galaxy Australia has been upgraded to the latest Galaxy release. Version 20.01.
This morning after a brief planned outage, Galaxy Australia was upgraded to the latest version of Galaxy. You will notice some changes straight away - The tool menu is a bit easier to read now. Everything else is the same however!

This release includes:

  • Workflow invocation view
  • More visualisations
  • More datatypes

Please see the user release notes for additional information.

Alternatively, see the full release notes
entry.summary: Galaxy Australia has been upgraded to the latest Galaxy release. Version 20.01. Everything else is the same however!

entry.title: Galaxy Version 20.01 Released
entry.content:
Galaxy 20.01 has now been released!
This release includes:

  • New workflow executions menu - track your workflow as it executes
  • Enhanced workflow functionality - optional parameters and more
  • Email notifications of completed jobs

Please see the user release notes for additional information.

Alternatively, see the full release notes.

Galaxy Australia will be moving to this Galaxy version in mid March. More information will be forthcoming.
entry.summary: Galaxy 20.01 has now been released! This release includes:

entry.title: Galaxy Australia contributes to global research effort into COVID-19

link.title: Galaxy Australia contributes to global research effort into COVID-19

entry.content:
A joint paper by Galaxy teams from Australia, Europe and the United States demonstrated how the COVID-19 genome data can be shared, analysed and reproduced in an efficient and transparent way. Find the paper at https://www.biocommons.org.au/galaxy-covid-19 and the workflows ready for use here in Galaxy Australia under Shared Data / Workflows.

Galaxy Australia Team
entry.summary: A joint paper by Galaxy teams from Australia, Europe and the United States demonstrated how the COVID-19 genome data can be shared, analysed and reproduced in an efficient and transparent way. Find the paper at https://www.biocommons.org.au/galaxy-covid-19 and the workflows ready for use here in Galaxy Australia under Shared Data / Workflows.
